00150         /*  Obsolete - use the overloaded function instead.
00151             Opens the video channel and sets the bounding rectangle for the video frames, which will be
00152             used to display the video content set by VideoChannel::RenderFrame. VideoChannel::Close
00153             should be invoked when the no frames are rendered anymore.
00154             @param video_frame_rect     [IN/OUT] Position and size of area to be filled with video.
00155             @param cb_frame_rendered    [IN] Pointer to callback function which is called when the rendering
00156                                         of a frame has been completed (i. e. the frame is written to the display
00157                                         buffer, the transfer of frame from display buffer to LCD is not
00158                                         included).
00159             @param context              Context (e.g. this pointer) of the calling application.
00160                                         This context will be passed in the callback function.
00161             @return                     TRUE if the video channel could be opened.
00162             @see CbVideoFrameRendered*/
00163         BOOLEAN Open(Rect& video_frame_rect, CbVideoFrameRendered cb_frame_rendered, void* context = 0);
00164 
00165         /*  Opens the video channel and sets the bounding rectangle for the video frames, which will be
00166             used to display the video content set by VideoChannel::RenderFrame. VideoChannel::Close
00167             should be invoked when the no frames are rendered anymore.
00168             @param cb_frame_rendered    [IN] Pointer to callback function which is called when the rendering
00169                                         of a frame has been completed (i. e. the frame is written to the display
00170                                         buffer, the transfer of frame from display buffer to LCD is not
00171                                         included).
00172             @param context              Context (e.g. this pointer) of the calling application.
00173                                         This context will be passed in the callback function.
00174             @return                     TRUE if the video channel could be opened.
00175             @see CbVideoFrameRendered*/

00256 #ifdef APOXI_COMPAT_2_6_0
00257         /*  Obsolete - use the method SetVideoSize instead.
00258             Sets the actual size of the video in pixels. The actual size can be determined
00259             by analyzing the transport format of the video or the encoded elementary stream directly.
00260             (Compare to 'extended size' as defined by some codec standards, which is the actual size
00261             rounded up to a full integer number of macroblocks)
00262             @param video_size       [IN] Actual size of the decoded video as determined by analyzing
00263                                     the videos transport format or the elementary stream */
00264

00269         #endif //  APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0

00271 #endif // APOXI_COMPAT_2_6_0

00299 #ifdef APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0
00300         /*  Obsolete - use the overloaded method instead.
00301             Defines a sub rectangle within the decoded video.
00302             The coordinates are relative to the upper left corner of the video. The rectangle may never
00303             exceed the size of the decoded video i.e. the cropping rectangle must always lie completely within the video.
00304             Together with video frame rectangle this implicitly also defines a zoom factor - the content of the
00305             cropping rectangle is zoomed up or down to best fit to the video frame rectangle. This is limited by the capability
00306             of the transformation blocks for zoom and crop (i.e. in most cases the hardware).
00307             @param crop_rect    [IN/OUT] Position and size of area to be cut out from the original video.
00308             @return             TRUE if the setting of the parameter was possible in the transformation blocks.
00309                                 If it was not possible FALSE is returned and the cropping rectangle contains the best effort
00310                                 of the transformation blocks to fit to the desired rectangle. */
00311         BOOLEAN SetCropRect(Rect& crop_rect);
00312 #endif // APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0
00313 
00327         BOOLEAN SetCropRect(Rect& crop_rect, Rect& effective_playback_rect);
00328 
00329 #ifdef APOXI_COMPAT_2_6_0
00330         /*  Obsolete - use the method SetPlaybackRect instead.
00331             Adjusts the size and position of the actual video area on the screen.
00332             The rectangle is initially set when opening a channel with DisplayChannel::Open but can be changed dynamically with this method.
00333             @param video_frame_rect     [IN/OUT] Position and size of screen area to be filled with video.
00334             @return                     TRUE if the setting of the parameter was possible in the underlying HW.
00335                                         If it was not possible, FALSE is returned and the  video frame rectangle
00336                                         contains the best effort of the hardware to fit the desired rectangle. */
00337         BOOLEAN AdjustFrameRect(Rect& video_frame_rect)
00338         {
00339         #ifdef APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0
00340             return SetFrameRect(video_frame_rect);
00341         #else
00342             return FALSE;
00343         #endif //  APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0
00344         }
00345 #endif // APOXI_COMPAT_2_6_0
00346 
00347 #ifdef APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0
00348         /*  Obsolete - use the function SetPlaybackRect instead.
00349             Adjusts the size and position of the actual video area on the screen.
00350             The rectangle is initially set when opening a channel with DisplayChannel::Open but can be changed dynamically with this method.
00351             @param video_frame_rect     [IN/OUT] Position and size of screen area to be filled with video.
00352             @return                     TRUE if the setting of the parameter was possible in the underlying HW.
00353                                         If it was not possible, FALSE is returned and the  video frame rectangle
00354                                         contains the best effort of the hardware to fit the desired rectangle. */
00355         BOOLEAN SetFrameRect(Rect& video_frame_rect);
00356 #endif // APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0

00369         BOOLEAN SetPlaybackRect(Rect& playback_rect,
00370                                 TransformationType playback_transformation,
00371                                 ScalingMethodType scaling_method);
00372 
00373 #ifdef APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0
00374         /*  Reads out the capabilities of the underlying layers to fulfill a certain programming for the video rectangles.
00375             Constraints generally come in due to the utilized hardware blocks.
00376             Underlying layers try to achieve a best effort to reach the desired rectangles - if this cannot be achieved
00377             the nearest possible rectangles are returned. It is ensured, that these rectangles will never be larger.
00378             The returned rectangles can the be used in VideoChannel::SetCropRect and VideoChannel::AdjustFrameRect which guarantees that
00379             these functions will be successful.
00380             @param video_frame_rect     [IN/OUT] Position and size of screen area to be filled with video.
00381             @param crop_rect            [IN/OUT] Position and size of area to be cut out from the original video.
00382             @return                     TRUE if the setting of the parameter *would be* possible in the underlying hardware.
00383                                         If itwas not possible, FALSE is returned and the video frame rectangle and cropping rectangle
00384                                         contain the best effort of the hardware to fit the desired rectangles */
00385         BOOLEAN QueryRects(Rect& video_frame_rect, Rect& crop_rect);
00386 #endif // APOXI_COMPAT_2_8_0
00387

00399                             VideoAndViewfinderOrderType video_viewfinder_order);
